001
002import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
003
004/**
005 * sample http applet
006 *
007 * @author matecsaba
008 */
009public class addr {
010
011    /**
012     * this is needed for cli startup
013     *
014     * @param args command line parameters
015     */
016    public static void main(String[] args) {
017        addr app = new addr();
018        String a;
019        try {
020            ByteArrayOutputStream buf = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
021            a = "" + app.getClass();
022            a = app.httpRequest("http://localhost/" + a, "./" + a, "cli",
023                    "clibrowser", "user", args, buf);
024            a = "type=" + a + "\r\ndata:\r\n" + buf;
025        } catch (Exception e) {
026            a = "exception " + e.getMessage();
027        }
028        System.out.println(a);
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * do one request
033     *
034     * @param url url of app
035     * @param path path of app
036     * @param peer client address
037     * @param agent user agent
038     * @param user auth data
039     * @param par parameters
040     * @param buf result buffer, if empty, pathname must present
041     * @return [pathname"][file name.]extension
042     * @throws Exception if something went wrong
043     */
044    public String httpRequest(String url, String path, String peer,
045            String agent, String user, String[] par, ByteArrayOutputStream buf)
046            throws Exception {
047        String s = "<html><head><title>address</title></head><body bgcolor=black text=white>" + peer + "</body></html>";
048        buf.write(s.getBytes());
049        return "html";
050    }
051
052}
